intro: Sisymbrium turcomanicum, commonly known as the Turkestan mustard, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other mustard species. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and alternate leaves that are lance-shaped. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in racemes and bloom in the summer months. The seeds are small and capsule-like, containing a high oil content, which makes them valuable for both culinary and industrial uses.
